title: Skookumchuck
text:
Skookumchuck () is a <a href="Chinook%20Jargon">Chinook Jargon</a> term that is in common use in <a href="British%20Columbia%20English">British Columbia English</a> and occurs in <a href="Pacific%20Northwest%20English">Pacific Northwest English</a>. "<a href="Skookum">Skookum</a>" means "strong" or "powerful", and "chuck" means water, so "skookumchuck" means "<a href="rapids">rapids</a>" or "<a href="whitewater">whitewater</a>" (literally, "strong water"), or fresh, healthy water. It can mean any rapids, but in coastal usage refers to the powerful <a href="tidal%20rapid">tidal rapid</a>s at the mouths of most of the major <a href="fjord">coastal inlet</a>s.
